Russia unleashes mass plunder of Ukrainian homes in occupied areas
subhead: A law signed by Vladimir Putin on December 15, 2025, encourages large-scale expropriation of property owners in areas occupied by the Russian army. Kyiv condemns the move as 'population replacement.'

title: Zelensky names spy chief Budanov as new head of Ukraine's presidential office
Mamdani, inaugurated as New York mayor, must now deliver on promises that secured his victory
Switzerland in shock after tragic bar fire: 'It was a war zone. Burned hair, faces and hands'
subhead: The upscale French-speaking Alpine resort of Crans-Montana is in mourning after a fire in a bar claimed the lives of around 40 people and left 115 others seriously injured. Heart-wrenching testimonies and unanswered questions are pouring in.

title: Israel halts the work of humanitarian NGOs in occupied Palestinian territories
subhead: Aid organizations operating in Gaza and the West Bank were required to submit lists of their Palestinian staff to the Israeli administration by December 31 for vetting by intelligence services. Thirty-seven of these organizations have already lost their accreditation.

title: Poland's iconic 1989 round table consigned to museum
subhead: This symbolic piece of furniture, on which communist leaders and democratic activists reached agreement, is leaving the presidential palace. The decision by nationalist President Karol Nawrocki is sparking debate in the country.

title: How four years of war in Ukraine redefined the European Union
subhead: With Russia's aggression against Ukraine, the world that saw the construction of EU has all but disappeared. The 27 member states belatedly recognized that peace was 'no longer a given in Europe,' and awoke to their military weakness and energy dependence.

Early Christian fresco depicting Jesus as the Good Shepherd discovered in Turkey
subhead: One month after Pope Leo XIV's visit, Turkish authorities announced the discovery in Iznik, Anatolia, of a depiction of Christ in a well-preserved burial chamber.

title: 'I did it for the money, but I wasn't proud': Parties that hire 'dwarves' for entertainment
subhead: Hiring women or men of short stature to 'spice up' parties has become increasingly common in Europe in recent years. These practices raise both moral and legal questions.

title: 'In the beginning, I was very diligent, more than other believers from Muslim backgrounds': Grégory's conversion to Islam
subhead: 'Changing Faith' (3/11). Why do people choose a particular religion? Attracted from a young age to Islam, Grégory Gonty, a 35-year-old Belgian social worker, became Muslim at the age of 21. The fervent believer has since become a knowledgeable and inquisitive practitioner.
